Practical Placeholders

Source: vignettes/practical.Rmd
practical.Rmd
library(lipsum)

Customisable Lorem Ipsum: Loripsum

The loripsum() function is probably the best go-to place holder text API in the package, and provides the most control over the output as far as contents are concerned.

example_loripsum <-
  loripsum(
    n = 3L,
    length = "short",
    decorate = TRUE, # adds italics, bold, etc.
    link = TRUE, # adds some links
    ul = TRUE, # adds an unordered list (bullets)
    ol = TRUE, # adds an ordererd list (numbers)
    dl = TRUE, # adds a description list (headers and contents)
    bq = TRUE, # adds a blockquote
    code = TRUE, # adds code samples
    headers = FALSE, # adds headers - may mess with RMarkdown/Quarto!
    allcaps = FALSE, # capitalises the whole output
    prude = TRUE # see above note
  )
View Output

  4. Non quaeritur autem quid naturae tuae consentaneum sit, sed quid disciplinae.
  5. Qualem igitur hominem natura inchoavit?

praetermissurum credam aut mortis aut doloris metu.

voluptatibus.

  • Quod autem meum munus dicis non equidem recuso, sed te adiungo socium.
  • Cuius etiam illi hortuli propinqui non memoriam solum mihi afferunt, sed ipsum videntur in conspectu meo ponere.

Markdown-formatted: Lorem Markdownum

The Lorem Markdownum API is similar to the Loripsum API in terms of giving a lot of control over the output, but outputs the place holder text using markdown formatting.

example_markdown <-
  lipsum::markdownum(
    n = 10L,
    # drop various elements?
    no_headers = TRUE,
    no_code = FALSE,
    no_inline_markup = FALSE,
    no_quotes = FALSE,
    no_lists = FALSE,
    no_external_links = FALSE,
    no_wrapping = FALSE,
    # change formatting?
    underline_headers = TRUE,
    reference_links = TRUE,
    underscore_em = TRUE,
    underscore_strong = TRUE,
    fenced_code_blocks = TRUE
  )
View Output

Random Corporate Articles: CorporateLorem

CorporateLorem is very different from Loripsum in that users get exceedingly little control over the output. In fact, the only control one truly gets is the number of paragraphs returned. However, unlike other lorem ipsum generators, the user receives actual English prose from a variety of topics. This output may be a bit less distracting to colleagues/clients compared to random Latin phrases.

example_corporate <-
  lipsum::corporatelorem(n = 3L)
View Output

Sports Agüero’s latest goal puts him alongside Alan Shearer in one respect. They are the only two players in the Premier League era to score 20 times or more in six different seasons. Yet the more important detail relates to what that goal means for the title race on a day when the supporters of Liverpool, an hour into the game, might have dared to think the momentum was about to swing dramatically their way. Naturally, when teams shrug at the free-agent market, it manifests itself in salaries below players’ expectations. But the widespread rebuilding phenomenon — or tanking, as some call it — resulted in eight teams with at least 95 losses last season, the most in history. It was no coincidence that attendance also dropped by more than three million fans, falling below 70 million for the first time since 2003. No sport is more often used to tell the story of America than baseball. Yet Marcenia Lyle Stone, known as Toni, who became the first woman ever to play big-league professional baseball when she took the field as a second baseman for the Negro Leagues’ Indianapolis Clowns in 1953, has largely been relegated to a footnote in history: one in a long list of African-American women who endured hardships, overcame discrimination and helped shape the nation only to be shoved aside, their contributions minimized.
